channel.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
channel.description:
Well im learning more in-depth into ZBrush and as i experiment and get used to it im going to post outputs here.
My first: [img]http://img40.imageshack.us/img40/3305/tenticle.png[/img]
Just did something simple, any comments?
3ds max junk is towards the end of this page etc

item.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Thats very… umm odd looking… 0o[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2009, 05:44:09 pm[/size][hr]Alright making another switch, this time to 3DS Max :s. Ill post shit i make here so i have something to do.


Note that that is not a sphere with a shit texture thrown on

WAAAAYYYY to sharp i know, but still learning VRay. Those also aren’t my materials because im still learning (i did the same thing with C4D up to a point)

Read full topic

item.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Not trying to steal your thunder or anything. I don’t want to make a new thread for simple tests if you already have one, and I’m only posting one.



Didn’t get very far on it. I was planning on giving it a shell or something with some exposed organs.

You’ll see the reptile when it’s completed though

Read full topic
item.source: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump

item.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:22, topic:307435”]Uh that’s the way to do it with Zpheres II.

And the shift key isn’t the move tool, that’s the SMOOTH brush. If that’s set to 100 intensity, it will CRUSH your model lol. Maybe that’s the problem. Keep it lower than 15 for best results.[/quote]
Oh i know that shift is smooth but i never knew that the intensity effected smooth 0o

And i looked around and cant find a 3.5 torrent… i have 3.1 wanna help me out nudge nudge

Read full topic

item.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Uh that’s the way to do it with Zpheres II.

And the shift key isn’t the move tool, that’s the SMOOTH brush. If that’s set to 100 intensity, it will CRUSH your model lol. Maybe that’s the problem. Keep it lower than 15 for best results.

Read full topic
item.source: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump

item.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:20, topic:307435”]Won’t let me PM you so…

What move tool are you using?

Hopefully not the one that’s to the right of the Draw tool and next to Rotate and Scale.

And if you’re using the smooth BRUSH, and want more precision of certain points, set the size to 1, otherwise keep it around 20/30.

If all of that is fine, maybe your models are too small. Maybe when you draw them out with zpheres, you make the zpheres pretty small and so when everything is moved it’s intensified.[/quote]
Pruned my messages if that was the problem

No i was using the move brush I usually use shift to move though.

If there was a way to make the zphere mesh skinny and not bulky i could work the other way around, adding muscle on etc. I pwn at that IMO. Shaving off polys is alot harder to me.

Read full topic
item.source: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump

item.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Won’t let me PM you so…

What move tool are you using?

Hopefully not the one that’s to the right of the Draw tool and next to Rotate and Scale.

And if you’re using the smooth BRUSH, and want more precision of certain points, set the size to 1, otherwise keep it around 20/30.

If all of that is fine, maybe your models are too small. Maybe when you draw them out with zpheres, you make the zpheres pretty small and so when everything is moved it’s intensified.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:16, topic:307435”]That fish was starting to look pretty sick, but the topology is awful.

If the mouth had more work it’d start to be cool, even if the scales aren’t really fish scales at all.[/quote]
I was using some other scale alpha but yea they aren’t really fish scales.

What exactly do you mean by topology?

item.source: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump

item.title: Learning 3ds max, new dump :) - Previously my ZBrush dump
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:4, topic:307435”][quote author=Frell link=topic=403583.msg2988353#msg2988353 date=1255153243]

Needs to work on the suckers, and the texture of it is a bit eh.

Well its my first And its 1am (Which is late with a school schedule etc). And theres no texture on it, its just a model.

I took my old dragon head and played around:
[im g]http://img35.imageshack.us/img35/5889/dragonw.png[/ img]
[/quote]

I dont see how it being 1 am has anything to do with it.
texture : the feel of a surface or a fabric.

Whatever brush you’ve been using to make the scales(?) for the tentacles and the dragon, it looks really bad.
It looks like something I’d use to make a desert…

and the excessive veins/acne looks doesn’t look great IMO, the veins on the neck don’t even look like veins.[/quote]
Still experimenting And it was actually about 2am and it effects me because my eyes are halfway open blinking incredibly slow and having bury vision :P.

None of these are final images, im still experimenting, thats why i say im just posting outputs etc.

SomethingToHide:

The tentacle dips in a LOT right before it gets smaller at the tip.

Yea when the flatten tool had less to work with it pulls things around weird, but yes i see it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:3, topic:307435”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=403583.msg2988348#msg2988348 date=1255153045]
Needs to work on the suckers, and the texture of it is a bit eh.
[/quote]
Well its my first And its 1am (Which is late with a school schedule etc). And theres no texture on it, its just a model.

I took my old dragon head and played around:
[im g]http://img35.imageshack.us/img35/5889/dragonw.png[/ img][/quote]

I dont see how it being 1 am has anything to do with it.
texture : the feel of a surface or a fabric.

Whatever brush you’ve been using to make the scales(?) for the tentacles and the dragon, it looks really bad.
It looks like something I’d use to make a desert…

and the excessive veins/acne looks doesn’t look great IMO, the veins on the neck don’t even look like veins.

Read full topic
